title: ISic030120. Caduceus from an unknown Sicilian location
body:
1[---]νων δαμ[όσιον]

1[---]ΝΩΝΔΑΜ[.....]

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after published editions and photographs

English translation

public property of the people of [--?--]

commentary

The fragment appears to have the standard formulation of genitive plural ethnic and the word δαμόσιον. The presence of omega indicates a Hellenistic rather than classical date, but it is not clear that it can be assumed (as in Manganaro and Ampolo) on the basis of the visible letters to be necessarily third rather than fourth century BCE.

bibliography

  • 46.1298 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796
  • 56.1077.B10 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796
  • Manganaro 1996 143 with tav. 17 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001821
  • Ampolo 2006 186 appendix B no.10 with fig. 15 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002458
